issue.title: Upcoming 7.1 changes

repository.name: sidekiq
repository.description: Simple, efficient background processing for Ruby

issue.body:
## Sidekiq 7.1

- [x] #5766
  The return value isn't useful today and AJ's upcoming bulk API could really benefit from the change.
- [x] #5788
- [x] #5827 
- [x] #5825

## Sidekiq Pro 7.1

- [x] #5678 
   Empty batch behavior has always been documented as undefined so we can change it at any time.
- [x] #5818

## Sidekiq Enterprise 7.1

- [x] #5757
- [x] #5800
- [x] #5817 
- [x] #5902

issue.title: Sidekiq 7.1 warns when deprecated Redis commands are used

repository.name: sidekiq-scheduler
repository.description: Lightweight job scheduler extension for Sidekiq

issue.body:
From the changelog for 7.1.0: https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/blob/main/Changes.md#710

```
Migrate away from all deprecated Redis commands [#5788] Sidekiq will now print a warning if you use one of those deprecated commands.
```

When running the specs against the latest `~> 7` sidekiq which is ow 7.1.0...

```
$ SIDEKIQ_VERSION="~> 7.0" bundle exec rake spec
/home/tony/.rbenv/versions/3.2.2/bin/ruby -I/home/tony/.rbenv/versions/3.2.2/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rspec-core-3.12.0/lib:/home/tony/.rbenv/versions/3.2.2/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rspec-support-3.12.0/lib /home/tony/.rbenv/versions/3.2.2/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rspec-core-3.12.0/exe/rspec --pattern spec/\*\*\{,/\*/\*\*\}/\*_spec.rb

Randomized with seed 27881
....................[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
..[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/spec/support/store.rb:53:in `block in zrangebyscore'"]
......................................................................[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
......................................................................[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
.[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["/home/tony/workbench/sidekiq-scheduler/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
......................................................................
```

Sidekiq >= 7 requires Redis 6.2 or later, which has deprecated a list of commands mentioned here: https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/issues/5788

From what I can see, the gem only uses `zrangebyscore`.

issue.title: Fix a Sidekiq warning about deprecated hmset redis command
issue.body:
Replace a deprecated redis command hmset by hset.
Fixes a warning generated by https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/issues/5788, introduced in Sidekiq 7.1.0

issue.title: Migrate away from deprecated Redis commands
issue.body:
WIth Sidekiq 7.1, warnings are printed out (due to [sidekiq#5788](https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/issues/5788)).

**Logs**
```bash
[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `rpoplpush`command, called at ["***/gems/sidekiq-unique-jobs-8.0.2/lib/sidekiq_unique_jobs/locksmith.rb:315:in `rpoplpush'"]
```

issue.title: Move away from deprecated Redis commands

repository.name: sidekiq-scheduler
repository.description: Lightweight job scheduler extension for Sidekiq

issue.body:
Currently getting this warning : 
```
[sidekiq#5788] Redis has deprecated the `zrangebyscore`command, called at ["~/.rvm/gems/ruby-3.2.0/gems/sidekiq-scheduler-5.0.2/lib/sidekiq-scheduler/redis_manager.rb:109:in `block in get_schedule_changes'"]
```

We should move away from deprecated redis commands.

Sidekiq did it already, might contain useful pointers to help the transition : 
- https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/issues/5788
- https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/commit/1aca434e5cd830cbd0020f1f82ef3a3cb6b2d477

body:
The error you get with older versions of redis (6.0.9) is not intuitive at all

```log
RedisClient::CommandError: 
    ERR value is not an integer or out of range
```

In retrospective, after seen this was related to a redis version upgrade, I should looked up immediately for my server's version. 
Leaving these in here, since there aren't results on google linking this error and sidekiq

> The error you get with older versions of redis (6.0.9) is not intuitive at all
> 
> ```
> RedisClient::CommandError: 
>     ERR value is not an integer or out of range
> ```
> 
> In retrospective, after seen this was related to a redis version upgrade, I should looked up immediately for my server's version. Leaving these in here, since there aren't results on google linking this error and sidekiq

Are you able to figure out the resolution of this issue?

oh, sorry I should have been more explicit, the solution is upgrading to a version of redis greater than 6.2, but prior to that version(at least 6.0.9) you get that error `ERR value is not an integer or out of range` which is really cryptic

Hey @mperham !

Would it be possible to reflect the changes from this issue in the documentation?

I was just reading some docs of Super Fetch and it gave me a bit of confusion that it mentions [here](https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/wiki/Reliability#using-super_fetch) that RPOPLPUSH is used, when based on my understanding of this issue it is no longer used as it is deprecated as of Redis 6.2.0.

> Sidekiq Pro offers an alternative fetch strategy, super_fetch, for job processing using Redis' [RPOPLPUSH](http://redis.io/commands/rpoplpush) command which keeps jobs in Redis. 

If I've misunderstood in some way please let me know!

@d-wierdsma You've got to remember that the vast bulk of my customer base aren't running the latest. The wiki documentation needs to help both old and new versions as much as possible. It's not terribly interesting that RPOPLPUSH has been replaced, people can figure out that Sidekiq has migrated to use the newer LMOVE.
No worries! Thanks for the explanation :D
